2. Useful coordinating library

2.1. Introduction

This page is used to present all the coordinating libraries used in the Ensmasteel bot. This description includes :

  • The communication library which includes useful tools to set up communications with the bot.

  • The enum library, containing all the enumerations used along the main code

  • The logger library, containing all the informations used to log information, debugging infos and useful error messages.

  • The vector library, defining vector type, used to model position, speed and acceleration.

  • The encoder library, used to encode message and information in order to communicate them through the communication port.

  • The ErrorManager library, which combined with the logger one enables you to correctly handle errors raised by the code.

Note

This page is only for coordinating libraries, for actuators please see Actuators documentation, and for robot functionalities please have a look to Useful coordinating library.

2.2. Communication

This refers to the Communication.h file, which defines lot of functionalities and models to set up communication in the robot and with the environnement, whether its a computer or not.

Note

Please note that all functions in this API can help you setting up useful tools such as communication ports.

Defines

ANTISPAM_MS

Functions

Message newMessage(MessageID id, int32_t data)

Constructor of a new message passing an ID and the data as parameters.

Parameters

  • id – : the message ID of the message

  • data – : The data contained in the message

Returns

a Message ready to send.

Message newMessage(MessageID id)

Another public constructor, getting only the ID.

Parameters

id – The message ID of the message.

Returns

a Message ready to send, with no Data. Can be fill up later.

Message newMessage(MessageID id, uint8_t byte0, uint8_t byte1, uint8_t byte2, uint8_t byte3)

Another public constructor, getting four bytes as parameters, and the ID. Ensure you to construct a 6 bytes Message.

Parameters

  • id – The message ID.

  • byte0 – The first byte of you data.

  • byte1 – The second one.

  • byte2 – The third one.

  • byte3 – The fourth one.

Returns

A message ready to send, only on 6 bytes.

Message newMessage(MessageID id, VectorE vectorE)

A constructor to create a message containing a vector of data. Ensure that the vector is encoded on 4 bytes.

Parameters

  • id – The message ID

  • vectorE – The vector containing the data you want to send.

Returns

A message ready to send, containing the data of the vector.

MessageID extractID(Message message)

Returns the ID of a message. Useful to read the information got from the sender.

Parameters

message – A message to read.

Returns

The message ID.

FourBytes extract4Bytes(Message message)

Extract a 4 bytes data from the message.

Parameters

message – The message to read

Returns

FourBytes, the data to use, encoded on 4 bytes.

int32_t extractInt32(Message message)

Extract an int32_t data (aka a 4 bytes data but encoded all in once).

Parameters

message – The message to read

Returns

int32_t, the data to use in one unique variable.

Vector extractVectorE(Message message)

Does the same as above, but useful when the message is send with a Vector.

Parameters

message – The message to read

Returns

The vector contained in the message.

Actuator_Order extractOrder(Message message)

Extract the order contained in the message. Uses all the functions above.

Parameters

message – The message to read containing an order.

Returns

Actuator_Order the order to send to actuators.

struct FourBytes
#include <Communication.h>

Struct to ensure that the message passed is on 4 bytes.

Public Members

uint8_t byte0
uint8_t byte1
uint8_t byte2
uint8_t byte3
struct Message
#include <Communication.h>

Struct to ensure the message is encoded on 6 bytes.

Public Members

int32_t _data
uint16_t _ID
class Communication
#include <Communication.h>

Class defining the communications ways used in the robot.

Public Functions

void send(Message message)

Send a message on the communication port.

Warning

this function is asynchronous.

Parameters

message – : the message to send.

void popOldestMessage()

Pop the oldest message in the reception box.

Message peekOldestMessage()

Pop the oldest message in the reception box and returns it.

Returns

Message, the oldest message in the reception box.

uint8_t inWaitingRx()

Gives the number of messages contained in the reception box and waiting for treatment.

Returns

uint8_t, the number of messages.

uint8_t inWaitingTx()

Same as above but with the sender box.

Returns

uint8_t, the number of messages waiting.

void update()

To be called regularly. Updates the reception and emission box.

Communication(Stream *port = &Serial)

Constructor of the communication port.

Parameters

port – the port to use for communication.

void operator=(const Communication &other)

Redefinition of the operator ‘=’, to ensure there is no pointer on local variables.

Parameters

other – Any other communication port.

void toTelemetry()

Method to send information to the telemetry.

Private Members

Stream *port
uint32_t millisLastSend
MessageBox *sendingBox
MessageBox *receiveBox

2.3. Enumerations

This library includes all the enumerations used in the robot code. They are useful to type some class and give some precious information about what to do with message for example.

Note

Please note that these enumerations may be updated every year because of specificities of the new cup regulation.

2.3.1. MessageID enumeration

This enumerations enables to characterize messages with useful informations such as actuator Action_order.

Defines

DROIT_byteM
GAUCHE_byteM

Enums

enum MessageID

This file defines the enumerations usefull to defines the actuators states and message IDs. This enum contains all the possible MessageID. This enum has to be updated every year before the cup. Each documentation of a member of this enum has same structure : [the sender > the receptioner] : the action described | the data contained in the type of message (optional)

Values:

enumerator Empty_M

Empty message.

enumerator Stop_M

[Teensy -> Aux]: Stops the actuators

enumerator Tirette_M

[Mega -> Teensy]: zipper pulled over.

enumerator PID_tweak_M

[Aux -> Teensy]: Change PID | DATA: 4 bytes [bool incr, bool translation, wichOne (P=0,I=1,D=2)]

enumerator add_forward_M

[Aux -> Teensy]: Add a forward order at the end of the pincipal queue

enumerator add_backward_M

[Aux -> Teensy]: Add a backward order at the end of the principal queue

enumerator add_spin_M

[Aux -> Teensy]: Add a spin order at the end of the principal queue

enumerator Em_Stop_M

[Aux -> Teensy]: Emergency Stop

enumerator Evitemment_M

[Mega/Aux -> Teensy]: There might be an obstacle | DATA: Vector (obstacle pos)

enumerator North_M

[Camera -> Teensy]: It must end at north [[deprecated in the 2022 edition]]

enumerator South_M

[Camera -> Teensy]: It must end at south [[deprecated in the 2022 edition]]

enumerator Pavillon_M

[Teensy -> Mega]: Rise the ‘Pavillon’! | byte0 = Actuator_Order |

enumerator BrasG_M

[Teensy -> Mega]: Get the left arm IN or OUT | byte0 = Actuator_Order |

enumerator BrasD_M

[Teensy -> Mega]: Get the right arm IN or OUT | byte0 = Actuator_Order |

enumerator PinceAvG_M

[Teensy -> Mega]: Ascend, descend, open or close the left front gripper | byte0 = Actuator_Order |

enumerator PinceAvD_M

[Teensy -> Mega]: Ascend, descend, open or close the right front gripper | byte0 = Actuator_Order |

enumerator PinceArr_M

[Teensy -> Mega]: Ascend, descend, open or close the back gripper | byte0 = Actuator_Order |

enum Actuator_Order

Enum containing the byte0 of each order to precise the exact action to do. To be adapt for each cup occurrence.

Each entry of the enum will be documented this way : target actuator | description of action

Values:

enumerator Sortir

arm | getting out the arm

enumerator Rentrer

arm | getting in the arm

enumerator Monter

Pavillon | Rails, ascend.

enumerator Descendre

Pavillon | Rails, downing.

enumerator Stock

Rails | assembly of action, getting a cup, ascending arm, downing it.

enumerator Destock

Rails | assembly of actions, ascending arm, getting cup, downing it, open gripper.

enumerator Fermer

Gripper | close it.

enumerator Ouvrir

Gripper | open it.

2.3.2. MoveProfile enumeration

This enumeration enables to characterize the robot movements and to invoke the right command at the right time during movement operations.

Enums

enum MoveProfileName

File describing all of the movement profiles with enums and class. Enum containing precisions on movement profile and states. This enum may not be updated.

Values:

enumerator off

Robot off.

enumerator brake

brake order

enumerator accurate

Precision state good.

enumerator standard

Standard state, everything good.

enumerator fast

Fast profile, concerning when the robot is accelerating and moving faster.

enumerator recalibrating

When the PID and the coder are recalibrating.

enumerator __NBPROFILES__

counts the number of moving profiles .

class MoveProfile
#include <MoveProfile.h>

Class containing the moving profile and defining the actions lead by each.

Public Members

float KP
float KI
float KD
float KA

PID factors : Proportional, Integrator, Diverter, Anticipator.

float epsilon
float dEpsilon

Factors below which we consider the robot is good for position and speed.

float maxErr

Max error before considering the robot went to far.

float speedRamps

Acceleration (positive or negative) in m.s-2 or rad.s-2.

float cruisingSpeed

Max speed (or rotating speed) in m/s (or rad/s)

Private Functions

void set(float KP, float KI, float KD, float KA, float epsilon, float dEpsilon, float maxErr, float speedRamps, float cruisingSpeed)

Friends

friend class MoveProfiles
class MoveProfiles
#include <MoveProfile.h>

Setting move profiles for all robot.

Public Static Functions

static void setup()

Public initializer. To call at initialization.

static MoveProfile *get(MoveProfileName name, bool translation)

Public constructor for move profiles.

Parameters

  • name – : Profile name

  • translation – : Bool, determined if param will consider translation or rotation.

Returns

An instance of MoveProfiles

static float tweak(MoveProfile *profile, bool incr, int whichOne)

Used to correct the PID factors.

Parameters

  • profile – : the profile impacted

  • incr – : to increment or decrement the factors

  • whichOne – : to chose which factor will be impacted (KP, KI, KD)

Returns

Float, the correct value of the new factor.

Private Static Attributes

static MoveProfile profiles[2 * __NBPROFILES__]

2.3.3. SequenceName enumeration

This enumeration enables you to characterize each sequence. That enables you to ensure which sequence is running.

Enums

enum SequenceName

This enum details the sequences’ names.

Values:

enumerator mainSequenceName

Defines the main sequence that will be performed on robot.

enumerator communicationSequenceName

Defines the communication sequence.

enumerator timeSequenceName

Defines the sequence organizing time.

enumerator goNorthName

Defines the sequence for going to North [[deprecated in 2022 edition ]].

enumerator goSouthName

Defines the sequence for going to South [[Deprecated in 2022 edition]].

enumerator recallageListerName

Defines the sequence for recalibrating the PID and coder.

enumerator __NBSEQUENCES__

Counts the number of sequences defined.

2.4. Logger

This API enables you to create a logger to log errors and informations messages during tests and robot running.

Defines

nameValue(a)

This class is used to write debug or info messages.

To write a debug message use : ‘’Logger::debug(String message)’’

To write an info message use : ‘’Logger::infoln(String infoMessage)

To add a variable to telemetry use : ‘’Logger::toTelemetry(String message, String(variable to get in telemetry))’’

Returns : Between # and EndLine, you’ll have an informative message Between @ and | you’ll have a parameter’s name Between | and EndLine, you’ll have its value Everything before @ or # will be debugging information.

class Logger
#include <Logger.h>

Defines the Logger class that will enables you to write messages.

Public Static Functions

static void debug(const String &message)

Print a message on debugPort. Works same as System.out.print in Java or std::cout<<message in C++.

Parameters

message – : String containing the message you want to print.

static void debugln(const String &message)

Same as debug, but add an EndLine character. Works same as System.out.println in Java.

Parameters

message – : String, the message you want to print.

static void infoln(const String &message)

Print an important message on infoPort and EndLine (mandatory).

Parameters

message – : String, The message you want to print on infoPort.

static void toTelemetry(const String &name, const String &value)

Send a named parameter to telemetry.

Parameters

  • name – : String, the parameter’s name.

  • value – : String, the parameter’s value, converted as a String.

static void setup(Print *telemetryPort = &Serial, Print *infoPort = &Serial, Print *debugPort = &Serial, bool telemetry = true, bool info = true, bool debug = false)

Set up all the necessary information to use the other functions. The port have to be initialized before being passed in argument of this function. Must be used before any other function in this module.

Parameters

  • telemetryPort – : The telemetry port.

  • infoPort – : The info Port

  • debugPort – : The debug Port

  • telemetry – : bool, Telemetry enabled? Default is true.

  • info – : bool, infoPort enabled? Default is true.

  • debug – : bool, debugPort enabled? Default is false.

Private Static Attributes

static Print *telemetryPort
static Print *infoPort
static Print *debugPort
static bool telemetryEnabled
static bool infoEnabled
static bool debugEnabled

2.5. Vector

The Vector class enables you to creates vectors to plot positions, uses velocity and kinetics to places and move the robot, targets and ghost. It overrides some classic operator to work with two vectors.

Enums

enum TeamColor

Enum defining the color team [[deprecated in 2022 edition]]

Values:

enumerator BLEU
enumerator JAUNE

Functions

float normalizeAngle(float angle)

Ensmasteel Library - Vector modelisation

author : Arthur FINDELAIR - EnsmaSteel, github.com/ArthurFDLR date : October 2019 Normalize an angle, from degree to rad.

Parameters

angle – : float, angle value in degree.

Returns

: float, angle value in rad.

Vector directeur(float theta)

Defines the principal vector.

class Vector
#include <Vector.h>

Class defining the vector model used in this code.

Subclassed by VectorE

Public Functions

Vector(float x = 0.0, float y = 0.0)

Public constructor of the vector.

Parameters

  • x – : float, X-axis coordinate.

  • y – : float, Y-axis coordinate.

Vector operator+(const Vector &other)

Redefines the + operator to work with vectors.

void operator+=(const Vector &other)

Redefines the += operator to work with vectors.

Vector operator-(const Vector &other)

Redefines the - operator to work with vectors.

float operator%(const Vector &other)

Scalar product.

Vector operator*(const float scalaire)

Homothety.

bool operator==(Vector const &other)

Redefines the == operator to work with vectors.

float norm()

Returns the vector’s norm.

float angle()

Returns the vector’s angle with base.

float distanceWith(Vector &other)

Returns the distance between two vectors.

void print(const String &prefix = "", bool info = false)

Prints the values of vectors.

void toTelemetry(const String &prefix = "")

Send the vectors’ info to telemetry.

Vector rotate(float theta)

Adds an angle to Vector.

Public Members

float _x
float _y

Coordinates of the vector.

2.6. Encoder

The encoder class enables to encode message to transfer them into message port and communication BUS.

Defines

2.7. Error Manager

The ErrorManager class enables you to handle errors without crashing the all system down. This class is useful in case of risky functionalities that may raise errors and bugs.

Enums

enum Error

Enum to detail some classic error codes. To be updated each time a new error is defined.

Values:

enumerator NO_ERROR

No error detected.

enumerator PID_FAIL_ERROR

Error on PID.

enumerator __NBERROR__

Counts the number of error types enumerated.

class ErrorManager
#include <ErrorManager.h>

The errorManager class handles each error and log them.

Public Static Functions

static void raise(Error error)

Raise an error.

static void popOldestError()

Delete the oldest error raised.

static Error peekOldestError()

Returns the oldest error raised( knowing that each iteration an error is archived).

static uint8_t inWaiting()

Returns the number of error messages waiting in the sender box.

static void setup()

Set every parameters up for usage. To be primary used before any other function in this module.

static void reset()

Reset every parameter to ensure no one is forgotten. To be called at the end of usage to reset all parameters for next usage.

Private Static Attributes

static ErrorBox *errorBox
static float *timeLastIn

2.8. Other Libraries and informations about Ensmasteel association

For further informations about other libraries please have a look to the documentation home page. To learn more about us, have a look to our GitHub page !
